title: Emotional mode guidance text and tonal UI per mode

requirements.summary: Display HAPPY mode guidance text with warm, grounded, celebratory UI tone
acceptanceCriteria: Selecting HAPPY mode displays the exact guidance text: "Share something real, not something impressive."
The guidance text area uses warm/golden color accents that visually differentiate it from other modes.
The overall form area conveys a warm, grounded aesthetic when HAPPY is active.

file_operations.description: Add conditional rendering logic to display the exact guidance text "Share something real, not something impressive." when the selected emotion mode is HAPPY. Apply warm color accents (amber/golden hues via Tailwind classes like bg-amber-50, text-amber-800, border-amber-200) to the guidance text container and surrounding form elements when HAPPY is active. Use gentle typography weight and calm spacing to convey a warm, grounded, quietly celebratory tone.

Add CSS custom properties for HAPPY mode tonal styling including warm/golden color tokens (e.g., --emotion-happy-bg, --emotion-happy-text, --emotion-happy-accent) using OKLCH color space to support the warm, grounded aesthetic required by the HAPPY emotion mode.

requirements.summary: Display CONFESS mode guidance text with gentle, human, witnessing UI tone
acceptanceCriteria: Selecting CONFESS mode displays the exact guidance text: "This space is for release, not applause."
The guidance and form area uses muted, gentle color treatment distinct from HAPPY and BROKE modes.
No bright accents; the visual feel is quiet and human.

file_operations.description: Add conditional rendering logic to display the exact guidance text "This space is for release, not applause." when the selected emotion mode is CONFESS. Apply muted, gentle color treatment (soft neutral tones via Tailwind classes like bg-gray-50, text-gray-700, border-gray-200) to the guidance text container and surrounding form elements when CONFESS is active. Use quiet typography with no bright or celebratory accents to convey a gentle, human, witnessing tone.

Add CSS custom properties for CONFESS mode tonal styling including muted neutral color tokens (e.g., --emotion-confess-bg, --emotion-confess-text, --emotion-confess-accent) using OKLCH color space to support the gentle, human, witnessing aesthetic required by the CONFESS emotion mode.

requirements.summary: Display BROKE mode guidance text with grounded, non-pressuring, safe UI tone
acceptanceCriteria: Selecting BROKE mode displays the exact guidance text: "Share what feels true right now. You don't have to explain everything."
The form area uses a subdued, low-contrast color treatment distinct from HAPPY and CONFESS.
The visual tone feels safe and unrushed.

file_operations.description: Add conditional rendering logic to display the exact guidance text "Share what feels true right now. You don't have to explain everything." when the selected emotion mode is BROKE. Apply subdued, low-contrast color treatment (muted tones via Tailwind classes like bg-slate-50, text-slate-600, border-slate-200) to the guidance text container and surrounding form elements when BROKE is active. Use gentle spacing and unhurried visual rhythm to convey a grounded, non-pressuring, safe tone.

Add CSS custom properties for BROKE mode tonal styling including subdued low-contrast color tokens (e.g., --emotion-broke-bg, --emotion-broke-text, --emotion-broke-accent) using OKLCH color space to support the grounded, safe, unhurried aesthetic required by the BROKE emotion mode.

requirements.summary: Display subtle safety footer for BROKE mode with PUBLIC visibility only
acceptanceCriteria: The safety footer appears only when both emotion mode is BROKE and visibility is PUBLIC.
The footer text exactly reads: "Veil is a reflection space. If you are in immediate danger, please contact local emergency services."
The footer uses small font size and muted/low-opacity text â€” it must not be visually alarming or prominent.
The footer does not appear for BROKE+PRIVATE posts.
The footer does not appear for HAPPY or CONFESS modes regardless of visibility.

file_operations.description: Add conditional rendering logic to display a subtle safety footer beneath the post creation form only when both emotionType is BROKE and visibility is PUBLIC. The footer must display the exact text: "Veil is a reflection space. If you are in immediate danger, please contact local emergency services." Apply subtle styling using small font size (text-xs), muted/low-opacity text color (text-gray-500/60), and no bold or alarming styling. Ensure the footer does not appear for BROKE+PRIVATE or for any other emotion mode (HAPPY, CONFESS) regardless of visibility.
